definition:
Two vectors, $v_1$ and $v_2$, are orthogonal if and only if their inner
product $\left<x,y\right>$is 0. In two dimensions, orthogonal vectors
are perpendicular (or in $n$ dimensions in the plane defined by the two
vectors.)

A set of vectors is orthogonal when, taken pairwise, any two vectors in
the set are orthogonal.
